title: We’ve Rounded Up the Best Gifts for Morning People
description: You probably know someone who has no trouble squeezing an entire 5-to-9 before their 9-to-5—and you're probably in awe of them. (Unless you're one of them, too, and in that case, this gift guide is for you!) Whether they're the type who's always making elaborate breakfasts, or they're the ones spending a few silent minutes alone journaling about the day before (or ahead!), our list of gift ideas for morning people are best enjoyed before sunrise. And nothing is more satisfying than a jammy, soft-boiled egg first thing in the morning. author: Morgan Bulman
excerpt: From the perfect egg timer to a toaster for the whole family, we've found the best gifts for the morning people in our lives.
text: You probably know someone who has no trouble squeezing an entire 5-to-9 before their 9-to-5—and you're probably in awe of them. (Unless you're one of them, too, and in that case, this gift guide is for you!) Whether they're the type who's always making elaborate breakfasts, or they're the ones spending a few silent minutes alone journaling about the day before (or ahead!), our list of gift ideas for morning people are best enjoyed before sunrise. Brainstream Singing Boiled Egg Timers, $50 We happily consume eggs at every meal, but they’re the bonafide champions of breakfast. And nothing is more satisfying than a jammy, soft-boiled egg first thing in the morning. If your giftee shares the same sentiment, they know that a minute can mean the difference between creamy and crumbly yolk. Rather than trusting a phone’s blaring timer, this precious pair is designed to join a boiling pot of water and sing a kitschy tune to alert them when it’s time to eat. Agent Nateur Pearly Whites Bundle, $36 Elevate a daily chore by gifting them this practical bundle of an Italian-made toothbrush—sweet stripes complete with nylon silk fibers!—and natural toothpaste. It brings together the bacteria-fighting and whitening prowess of Manuka honey, peppermint, aloe vera, jojoba seed oil, and cinnamon. Ichandorf Milano Fantasia Animal Tumbler, $25 Searching for an elevated set of juice glasses? Look no further than Ichendorf’s iconic tumblers. Choose your giftee’s favorite critters—a hedgehog, snail, turtle, or duck—to add a touch of whimsy to their kitchen cupboards. Plus, since these are constructed with durable borosilicate, you don’t have to worry about them snapping off while handwashing after each use. Heim Sohne Egg Spoon, $8 If brewing a fresh cup of coffee is their favorite morning ritual—from measuring out locally roasted beans to stirring grounds for a bubbly bloom—they likely already have a fancy French press or heavy-duty grinder. So gift them extras, like this tortoiseshell spoon that will make stirring in milk or sugar feel just as special as that first sip. It can also pull double duty for those whose caffeine vice skews towards tea or simply for scooping jams and creams. Dansk Købenstyle Butter Warmer, $48 Dansk’s designs have been gracing our dinner tables and stovetops for years. So if the brand is missing from the morning person in your life’s own collection, remedy that stat with its signature Købenstyle butter warmer. This miniature, enameled pot pairs a punchy color palette with a cool-to-the-touch teak handle and handy spout for mess-free, easy pouring. Those who love whipping up a batch of pastries or warming syrup before the rest of their house has risen will fall in love with this piece of cookware at first use—they’ll never have to worry about burning their hands on a microwaved dish again. Alex Mill Sherpa House Shoes, $65 After rolling out of bed, let them immediately slip into these new sherpa house shoes from Alex Mill. Handsewn in Japan, the contrasting color block is fully reversible, and the ribbed sock back provides a secure fit as they go about their morning routine. Mosser Glass Bathing Dish, $37 Sure, this cute catchall was likely fashioned with bars of soap in mind, but we can easily see it sitting pretty among a host-loving friend’s table of spreads at the next brunch gathering. Handcrafted in Ohio, this Mosser glass dish is an equally perfect perch for sugar cubes or tea bags. Photo by James Ransom Papier Wonder Wellness Journal, $35 Help your giftee carve out a mindful minute or two with Papier’s wellness journal. This silk-bound, hardcover book includes 12 weeks’ worth of prompts to log energy levels and intentions every morning (or evening!), along with weekly and monthly check-ins. Schoolhouse Gino Alarm Clock, $99 When the first thing they look at in the morning is this stylish, they're bound to have a good day. This vintage-inspired design comes from the one of the world's first flip clock manufacturers, and if we're being honest, puts any phone alarm to shame. Marmalade Grove “Sunrise” Pixie Tangerine Marmalade, $9 Aptly named, gift them a jar of something special to spread on their daily slice of toast. Beautifully packaged, your giftee may inquire if you scooped it up on a trip to the UK without them knowing, but in reality, this citrusy combo includes lemon and petite tangerines from California. Loftie Lamp, $275 The key to waking early without worry is all about a quality snooze beforehand. The Loftie Lamp functions as a sunrise alarm clock, mimicking the sun to lull them out of a slumber naturally. But it’s just as great at establishing a nighttime routine to keep their circadian rhythm in check. An LED red light setting (said to improve melatonin levels) soothes and signals it's time to sleep.
